cyclone.name: ISAIAS
cyclone.current_location: about 55 miles ESE of Cape Canaveral, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving north-northwest just offshore the east-central Florida coast, then forecast to accelerate north-northeast toward the Georgia/South Carolina coast and make landfall over eastern South Carolina or southern North Carolina before tracking up the U.S. East Coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: eastern South Carolina or southern North Carolina coast (roughly Myrtle Beach–Surf City area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Ocracoke Inlet NC to Watch Hill RI including Long Island Sound, Chesapeake Bay, Tidal Potomac and Delaware Bay (Tropical Storm Watch)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Sebastian Inlet FL to Ocracoke Inlet NC (Tropical Storm Warning); Edisto Beach SC to Cape Fear NC (Storm-surge warning)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida east coast through the Carolinas, Mid-Atlantic and New England coasts
weather_observation.wind: Occasional tropical-storm-force gusts (35–40 mph) possible in rainbands through Sunday night
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge less than 1 ft above ground along the Broward County coast
weather_observation.rainfall: Additional 1–3 inches of rain expected; localized totals near 4 inches cannot be ruled out
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents affecting port approaches and berth areas
